message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.IR, cs.DS

The paper discusses node classification in graphs using Graph Convolutional Networks (GCN) and focuses on the classification of papers in the CiteSeer and Cora datasets. This falls under the broad category of machine learning and specifically, the subfield of graph-based machine learning. The paper also mentions the use of topological features and information propagation, which are commonly used in the fields of network science and information retrieval. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), followed by cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), cs.IR (Information Retrieval), and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms).
